ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When he said to his people, 'Will you not have taqwa?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When he said to his people: "Will you not be mindful of God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (Call to mind) when he said to his people: “Will you not fear Allah?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He told his people, "Why do you not have fear of God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When he said to his people, “Do you not fear?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When he said to his people: "Will you not have Taqwa"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When he said to his people: Do you not guard (against evil)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when he said to his people, 'Will you not be godfearing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When he said unto his folk: Will ye not ward off (evil)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He said to his people, "Have you no fear [of God?]
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Recall what time he said Unto his people: fear ye not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When he said to his people, ‘Will you not be Godwary?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Behold, he said to his people, "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When he said to his people: "Will you not fear Allah?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He asked his people: 'Do you not fear (Allah)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said to his people, “Do you not fear?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allah?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:124] When (idh is dependent because of an implicit [verb] udhkur, ‘mention’) he said to his people, ‘Will you not fear [God]?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When he said unto his folk: Will ye not ward off (evil)) the worship of other than Allah?
